p: An. gambiae (G3 strain) and An. stephensi (Liston strain) were reared in the insectary at 29 °C ± 2 and 85% ± 5 relative humidity, with photoperiod (12:12 light:dark). Adult insects were maintained with 5% sucrose solution ad libitum, and adult females were fed on mouse blood for egg-laying. Eggs were collected on wet filter paper for 48 h before hatching. Larvae were maintained in spring water and fed daily with commercial fish food.
